title.narrative: 1.2 INCLUSIVE EDUCATION & ADOLESCENT LIFE-SKILLS & CITIZENSHIP EDUCATION

description.narrative: Service providers have increased capacity to deliver quality, inclusive education and provide opportunities to adolescents to develop and practice life-skills and citizenship education, including in humanitarian settings., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Adolescent Empowerment, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, more Palestinian children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from improved access to quality and inclusive learning opportunities in safe and protected environments and are better able to contribute to their community and national development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Service providers have increased capacity to deliver quality, inclusive education and provide opportunities to adolescents todevelop and practice life-skills and citizenship education, including in humanitarian settings.

description.narrative: Over 13,500 teachers were trained to enhance their capacity in teaching approaches to equip students with relevant life skills and citizenship education.17,348 adolescents were empowered with digital, entrepreneurial and civic engagement skills. ;UNICEF with UNFPA, UNDP, PMO and local partners completed an assessment of volunteerism in Palestine. Based on consultations with young people and stakeholders, a road map for establishing the NYVSP was drafted. UNICEF leveraged partnerships with UN agencies, private sector and CSO and reached over 3,000 young people through a hackathon. ;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022
